name: Granite
description: A very hard, granular, crystalline, igneous rock consisting mainly of quartz, mica, and feldspar and often used as a building stone.

name: Basalt
description: A dark, fine-grained volcanic rock that sometimes displays a columnar structure, typically composed largely of plagioclase with pyroxene and olivine.

name: Limestone
description: A sedimentary rock composed primarily of calcite or dolomite. The rock includes also traces of fossils of calcite-secreting organisms.

name: Sandstone
description: A type of rock made from sediment â€” a sedimentary rock. The sediment particles are clasts, or pieces, of minerals and fragments of rock, thus sandstone is a clastic sedimentary rock.

name: Slate
description: A fine-grained, foliated, homogeneous metamorphic rock derived from an original shale-type sedimentary rock composed of clay or volcanic ash through low-grade regional metamorphism.

name: Diorite
description: A grey to dark-grey intermediate intrusive igneous rock composed principally of plagioclase feldspar, biotite, hornblende, and pyroxene.

name: Gabbro
description: A dark, coarse-grained, intrusive mafic igneous rocks chemically equivalent to basalt, being its coarse-grained analogue.

name: Obsidian
description: A naturally occurring volcanic glass formed as an extrusive igneous rock. It is produced when felsic lava extruded from a volcano cools rapidly with minimal crystal growth.

name: Pumice
description: A type of extrusive volcanic rock, produced when lava with a very high content of water and gases is discharged from a volcano.

name: Rhyolite
description: A light-colored, fine-grained, extrusive igneous rock that typically contains quartz and feldspar minerals.

name: Andesite
description: An extrusive rock, intermediate in composition between rhyolite and basalt, typically porphyritic, containing larger crystals (phenocrysts) set in a fine-grained groundmass.

name: Pegmatite
description: A very coarse-grained igneous rock, with grain size over 2 cm, which often contains rare minerals not found in other rocks.

name: Peridotite
description: A dense, coarse-grained igneous rock, consisting mostly of the minerals olivine and pyroxene. Peridotite is ultramafic, as the rock contains less than 45% silica.

name: Scoria
description: A dark-colored, vesicular, extrusive igneous rock. The vesicles are a result of trapped gas within the melt at the time of solidification.

name: Tuff
description: A type of rock made of volcanic ash ejected from a vent during a volcanic eruption. Following ejection and deposition, the ash is compacted into a solid rock in a process called consolidation.

name: Shale
description: A fine-grained sedimentary rock that forms from the compaction of silt and clay-size mineral particles, often contains fossils.

name: Conglomerate
description: A coarse-grained sedimentary rock composed of rounded fragments within a matrix of finer grained material.

name: Breccia
description: A rock composed of broken fragments of minerals or rock cemented together by a fine-grained matrix.

name: Chalk
description: A soft, white, porous sedimentary rock which is a form of limestone composed of the mineral calcite.

name: Coal
description: A black or brownish-black sedimentary rock that's primarily composed of carbon along with various other elements, such as hydrogen, sulfur, oxygen, and nitrogen.

name: Dolomite
description: A sedimentary rock similar to limestone but contains magnesium as well as calcium.

name: Flint
description: A hard sedimentary rock, a variety of quartz, used in the past for making tools and recently for building walls.

name: Gypsum
description: A sedimentary rock composed primarily of calcium sulfate dihydrate, widely used for plaster, wallboard and sculptures.

name: Lignite
description: A soft, brownish coal showing traces of plant structure, intermediate between bituminous coal and peat.

name: Chert
description: A hard, dense, sedimentary rock composed of microcrystalline quartz.

name: Oolite
description: A sedimentary rock formed from ooids, spherical grains composed of concentric layers.

name: Travertine
description: A form of limestone deposited by mineral springs, especially hot springs.

name: Siltstone
description: A fine-grained sedimentary rock which is formed by the consolidation and compaction of silt.

name: Peat
description: A brown, soil-like material characterized by its high carbon content, formed from the remains of decayed plants over thousands of years.

name: Loess
description: A wind-blown sediment of silt-sized particles, typically light brown, loosely cemented by calcium carbonate.

name: Mudstone
description: A type of mudrock whose original constituents were clays or muds. Grain size is up to 0.0625 mm with individual grains too small to be distinguished without a microscope.

name: Oil Shale
description: A fine-grained sedimentary rock that contains significant amounts of kerogen (a solid mixture of organic chemical compounds), from which liquid hydrocarbons can be produced.

name: Arkose
description: A type of sandstone containing at least 25% feldspar.

name: Greywacke
description: A variety of sandstone generally characterized by its hardness, dark color, and poorly sorted angular grains of quartz, feldspar, and small rock fragments set in a compact, clay-fine matrix.

name: Phosphorite
description: A type of rock primarily rich in phosphate. Its deposition can be marine or terrestrial.
